question: What was the original name of Disney's Hollywood Studios when it first opened in 1989?
funFact: Disney's Hollywood Studios was originally named Disney-MGM Studios when it first opened in 1989.

question: Which Disney park is home to the 'Pirates of the Caribbean' attraction that was the first to be built with Jack Sparrow animatronics?
funFact: Disneyland Paris was the first Disney park to include Jack Sparrow animatronics in the 'Pirates of the Caribbean' attraction.

question: What is the name of the exclusive, members-only club located in Disneyland's New Orleans Square?
funFact: Club 33 is the exclusive, members-only club located in Disneyland's New Orleans Square.

question: Which attraction at Disney's Animal Kingdom features a 199-foot-tall artificial mountain?
funFact: Expedition Everest at Disney's Animal Kingdom features a 199-foot-tall artificial mountain and is the tallest of all Disney theme park mountains.

question: What is the name of the underground tunnel system used by Cast Members at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World?
funFact: The underground tunnel system used by Cast Members at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World is called the Utilidors.

question: Which Disney park is the only one that is not owned by The Walt Disney Company?
funFact: Tokyo Disneyland is the only Disney park not owned by The Walt Disney Company; it is owned by the Oriental Land Company.

question: What is the name of the nighttime spectacular at EPCOT that debuted in 2021?
funFact: Harmonious is the nighttime spectacular that debuted at EPCOT in 2021, replacing IllumiNations: Reflections of Earth.

question: In which Disney park can you find the attraction 'Mystic Manor'?
funFact: Mystic Manor is an attraction unique to Hong Kong Disneyland, offering a different take on the traditional haunted house.

question: Which attraction in Disneyland Park, Anaheim, was the first to use the innovative Omnimover ride system?
funFact: Adventure Thru Inner Space was the first attraction to use the Omnimover ride system when it opened in Disneyland Park, Anaheim, in 1967.

question: What was the name of the first ever Disney water park?
funFact: River Country, which opened in 1976 at Walt Disney World, was Disney's first ever water park.

question: Which Disney park is known for having the largest castle of all the Disney parks?
funFact: Shanghai Disneyland's Enchanted Storybook Castle is the largest of all the Disney park castles.

question: What is the name of the Halloween event held annually at Disneyland and Magic Kingdom?
funFact: Mickey's Not-So-Scary Halloween Party is the annual Halloween event held at both Disneyland and Magic Kingdom.

question: Which Disney park features the attraction 'Journey to the Center of the Earth'?
funFact: Journey to the Center of the Earth is a unique attraction located at Tokyo DisneySea.

question: What was the original name of Epcot when it opened in 1982?
funFact: Epcot was originally named Epcot Center when it opened in 1982.

question: Which Disney park has an attraction called 'Crush's Coaster'?
funFact: Crush's Coaster is a popular attraction at Walt Disney Studios Park in Disneyland Paris.

question: Which Disney park features the 'TRON Lightcycle Power Run' attraction?
funFact: TRON Lightcycle Power Run is an exciting roller coaster attraction located at Shanghai Disneyland.

question: Which Disney park's castle is inspired by Neuschwanstein Castle in Germany?
D: Château de la Belle au Bois Dormant
funFact: Sleeping Beauty Castle at Disneyland is inspired by Neuschwanstein Castle in Germany.

question: Which Disney park features the unique attraction 'Aquatopia'?
funFact: Aquatopia is a unique water-based attraction located at Tokyo DisneySea.

question: Which Disney park is home to the 'Avatar: Flight of Passage' attraction?
funFact: Avatar: Flight of Passage is an immersive attraction located in Pandora – The World of Avatar at Disney's Animal Kingdom.

question: Which Disney park's version of 'Space Mountain' is called 'Hyperspace Mountain'?
funFact: Disneyland Paris features 'Hyperspace Mountain', a Star Wars-themed version of the classic Space Mountain attraction.
